education.name: The University of Texas at Austin
education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

description: Currently working on handling imbalanced datasets in SparkCognition's AutoML pipeline called Darwin.
Designed and created an extensible and modular information retrieval tool with a partner.
Able to search over highly technical documents. Utilizes an ensemble model of TF-IDF, pesudo-PageRank, clustering, query expansion using custom word embeddings, and more.
Performed better than an in-house Apache Solr instance.
Automated the reading and writing of Key Performance Indicators to a database using Visual Basic.
Developed data quality monitors in QlikView which were used to support the rollout of a worldwide application.
Created an Android application on top of an API that allowed clients and developers to share usernames and passwords without storing them anywhere.
Repaired and maintained a client website and further prepared it for future mobile optimization.
Transferred user-password database information to in-house application to allow the company to operate in a more efficient manner.
Developed a methodology to train word embeddings given a small set of domain specific documents while maintaining natural laanguage properties vital to downstream applications.
Performed research to verify the aforementioned methodology emprically.
Implement and design assignment for student along with the other TA and Professor.
Student learn in an inverted classroom, allowing the TAs and Professor easy access to students' qustions and ideas.
Held office hours, graded projects, and guided students through their projects.

projects.name: Edge Fitting
projects.description: Implemented the Hough Transform to fit lines to edges in images.

projects.name: Trading Framework
projects.description: Developing a modular framework for automated trading of stocks.

projects.name: AES
projects.description: Implemented AES in EBC mode in Python. Supports both encryption and decryption with 128-bit and 256-bit keys.
